result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquentin P Glosson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now being served

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not possess any illegally controlled substances.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquentin P Glosson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment returned to defendant as premature.  He has not served the applicable period of confinement for a Class F felony.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (15 pages) commencing APRIL 21, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years - consecutive to time now being served; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) do not possess any illegally controlled substances; 4) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  William Berens, student, with Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State had the drugs tested and spoke with the lab.  State has conveyed the results to the defense, but has not received the written report yet.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney David P Geraghty in court, defendant Laquentin P Glosson not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense would like to discuss possible substitution of judge with codefendant's counsel before entering a plea.  Arraignment scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 44.  Original Information is filed, copy given to defendant.  Arraignment scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Laquentin P Glosson in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
